page.title: 11North Watford School changes
page.content: Walter de Merton JM School was opened in 1970 when there were too many children in Callowland Primary School. The infants stayed in the old building and the juniors moved to the new building which has a field, a woodland and a pond. Now there are fewer children coming to the 2 schools and they are being amalgamated to form Beechfield JMI and Nursery. The Nursery is being built now and an extra classroom. Our school is a very strange place at the moment. It is full of noise, workmen, bricks, cement and dust. The windows stay shut so that we can hear our teachers and each day our Assembly is interrupted by the builders hammering and the music from their radio. {Parkgate Junior School}is also being rebuilt with all the same problems. The Infants' new school was built in 1984.
